title: Does Aatrox suck now or am I doing it wrong?
body: I hadn't played him in quite some time, probably near his release, and the other day I hopped in the jungle thinking "he's got plenty of sustain, he should be good", and oh boy.  I haven't felt more worthless in a game in quite some time(compared to before, when jungling with him kinda felt like 'easy mode').  Did the change over to the new stat system and new jungle just punk him, or did he get some nerfs I never paid attention to?  Or is he still plenty strong and I just inexplicably kept dying to a kayle with no damage?  :D

replies.body: I have never been able to do good with Aatrox, and its nto like he's mechanically challenging or anything either

Jungling got a lot harder in 2015 so now it's a tricky place to navigate early on. Things to keep in mind:

Armor Seals always. Make sure you're running combat-relevant quints as well, not things like Move Speed. Start Q to make sure you start with a maxed Blood Well. Make sure to start Krugs or Gromp to get a combat-relevant buff for your first clear. I'm pretty sure every champion in the game can jungle up until their first jungle upgrade with no issues.

Medium-mobility melee champions' biggest difficulty is gauging engagements. If you're not familiar with the types of fights you can take as Aatrox, you end up Q'ing in and then just dying. On top of that, junglers get a little bit less income than laners, so you'll be on average less farmed than your opponents. So I'm not surprised that's been your initial experience.

The final thing to point out is item build. What I see being most successful is one core damage item, either just your jungle enchant, or in addition to the enchant, and then building tanky. This should keep you pretty relevant in terms of damage output, while also allowing you to sit on the front lines pretty well.
The "Armor Seals Always" isn't against the "Runes shouldn't affect the viability of champions" philosophy you have always had?

I think so too about any champ being able to get the first item, I've been messing around with this alot lately trying to find new junglers(Ziggs can jungle?!) :)

I'm thinking the main issue was trying to gauge the enemy threat.  From fighting in the jungle he has practically no risk as he sustains so well, but when you engage with a champ it's a whole different story.  I'd like to give some of this a shot because I really like his design and such, but that last attempt was seriously horrible :D  I also feel like he's outshined by alot of other champs right now(Lee can sustain almost as well and is much more helpful in a gank or skirmish), but that could also be largely due to unfamiliarity.
I've heard BORK, Hydra and then any combination of tank items works really well on Aatrox.

Attack speed goes well with him because of his W. Make sure to land the lift from your Q to land your E or get a free hit for your W. He's good with chasing and closing gaps (Q and E) so make sure you're using that. I think that he's just a bit harder of a champion now, but he really can have insane power.
Jungle aatrox is very good atm with a tank engage top. You can run warrior with stalkers smite and the ganks are so easy.
Aatrox is a Very strong champion but he lacks in the jungle cuz you have to choose sustain or clear i prefer him in the top lane where he has favorable matchups against most now meta tops
is he getting the new fear soon?  **"hold down to your buffs"**

He is better in top lane imho. Just played vs an Aatrox that was just unkillable, his passive is completely annoying, and it took us 3 or 4 to kill him late game. He heals constantly and if I remember correctly, dominated the whole game. We won though with 3 inhibs down. Sweet comeback.

Aatrox has always sucked.   Though I'm less talking about his power than his terrible design, bland voice over, cookie-cutter uninspired mechanics and awful art/character model.  I can't imagine a champion he design team failed on more.  NOTHING about that guy appeals to me at all.
